oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bioenergie versus Ökolandbau: Flächenkonkurrenz als Entwicklungshemmnis?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Simon, Sonja
Demmeler, Martin
Heißenhuber, Alois
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To satisfy national sustainability targets in Germany, both bioenergy and organic farming claim a growing area of farmland. Analyses with a land use model and ac-companying expert interviews show, how the competition for land is growing in certain regions. A restricted area potential for energy crops – even with an ever intensifying farming opposes targets for an increasing share of land for organic agriculture and nature conservation. Thus there is a need for policy action, to discuss and solve this goal conflict. An ongoing study currently develops strategies for two selected German regions for a more ecologically compatible bioenergy production.
